summary:
The Security Council, 
Determining the situation in the Former Yugoslavia remains a threat to international peace and security, 
Acting under Chapter VII of the UN Charter, 
1. Authorizes Member States, through or with the EU, to establish EUFOR ALTHEA, a multinational stabilization force, for 12 months, as a successor to SFOR, under unified command and control, to implement the Peace Agreement in Bosnia and Herzegovina, in cooperation with NATO. 
2. Renews the authorization provided in resolution 2183 (2014) for 12 months. 
3. Authorizes Member States to take measures to ensure compliance with Annexes 1-A and 2 of the Peace Agreement, holding parties equally responsible for compliance. 
4. Authorizes Member States to take measures in defence of EUFOR ALTHEA or NATO presence and to assist them in carrying out their missions. 
5. Authorizes Member States to ensure compliance with airspace rules and procedures over Bosnia and Herzegovina. 
6. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
